Android OpenCV library: 
-Version 2.4.11

Motion Tracking - Motion Tracking illuminates the changing contours in video frame. 
>>To set up: Place device steady and wait for background noise to dissipate. Objects moving in view will illuminate in a bright pink color.


Color Detection - Color Detection will place a bounding box around the color detected by user. 
>>To set up: Touch screen on area to get color sample. Once selected objects of that color in the spectrum will be placed inside a green bounding box and tracked.


(Beta)Counter - Counter captures any moving object and will place a bounding box around object and once the object passes the count line, the counter will be updated by 1 
>>To set up: Place device steady and wait for background noise to dissipate Objects moving will be placed inside a blue bounding box and will update the count and change counter line display red once the center passes the counter line threshold.


Bounding Box - Bounding Box will place a purple stationary box in center of screen, once user selects a object color to track the object will then have a cyan bounding box around it, once it enters entirely inside the stationary box it will then change to a red and display "Captured". 
>>To set up: Touch screen on area to get color sample. Once selected objects of that color in the spectrum will be placed inside a cyan bounding box and tracked. Move the device to place the object tracked inside the stationary purple box.


Edge Detection - Edge detection will find all edges in camera view and only display the picture with the edges highlighted in a blackscreen view 
>>To set up: Pan device around to watch the edges detected in real time in the view.
